entries.text: <?kgicon@90?> + <?kgicon@6?>: Boost Movement ON <?kgicon@8?>: Jump Hold <?kgicon@8?>: Ascend

Some actions consume EN (energy), and are disabled while EN is depleted.
EN replenishes rapidly when grounded.

The reticle automatically targets on-screen enemies.
When there are multiple enemies, the enemy closest to the center of the screen will be prioritized. Move the camera to change the priority target.
When enabled, Target Assist will automatically orient the camera and your AC toward the current target. However, this comes at the cost of reduced aiming precision. Consider the situation and your level of skill when choosing whether to enable this feature.
<?kgicon@11?>: Camera <?kgicon@15?>: Target Assist ON/OFF
<?kgicon@11?>: Camera <?kgicon@15?>: Target Assist ON/OFF Hold <?kgicon@18?>: Rapid-Fire Right Hand Weapon

The reticle automatically targets on-screen enemies.
When there are multiple enemies, the enemy closest to the center of the screen will be prioritized. Move the camera to change the priority target.
<?kgicon@91?>: Camera
<?kgicon@91?>: Camera Hold <?kgicon@18?>: Rapid-Fire Right Hand Weapon

Target Assist keeps your AC oriented toward the target.
When enabled, your AC will automatically lock its orientation toward enemies as you approach them. You can still use the camera to change targets while in Target Assist mode.
<?kgicon@15?>: Target Assist ON/OFF
<?kgicon@15?>: Target Assist ON/OFF <?kgicon@20?>: Use Right Shoulder Weapon <?kgicon@17?>: Use Left Hand Weapon

The reticle automatically targets on-screen enemies.
When there are multiple enemies, the enemy closest to the center of the screen will be prioritized. Move the camera to change the priority target.
<?kgicon@91?>: Camera Hold <?kgicon@18?>: Rapid-Fire Right Hand Weapon

Target Assist keeps your AC oriented toward the target.
When enabled, your AC will automatically lock its orientation toward enemies as you approach them. You can still use the camera to change targets while in Target Assist mode.
<?kgicon@15?>: Target Assist ON/OFF <?kgicon@20?>: Use Right Shoulder Weapon <?kgicon@17?>: Use Left Hand Weapon

The missile launcher equipped to the right shoulder of this AC is capable of multi-lock, which allows you to attack multiple enemies simultaneously by holding down the input for that weapon.
Hold <?kgicon@20?>: RSW Multi-Lock Attack
<?kgicon@90?> + <?kgicon@7?>: Quick Boost <?kgicon@17?>: Use Left Hand Weapon

Quick Boost (QB) lets you instantly accelerate in any direction, helping you to evade attacks or swiftly close in on enemies.
<?kgicon@90?> + <?kgicon@7?>: Quick Boost <?kgicon@17?>: Use Left Hand Weapon
<?kgicon@90?> + <?kgicon@7?>: Quick Boost Hold <?kgicon@18?>: Rapid-Fire Right Hand Weapon <?kgicon@20?>: Use Right Shoulder Weapon <?kgicon@17?>: Use Left Hand Weapon

Quick Boost (QB) lets you instantly accelerate in any direction, helping you to evade attacks or swiftly close in on enemies.
<?kgicon@90?> + <?kgicon@7?>: Quick Boost
<?kgicon@20?>: Use Right Shoulder Weapon Hold <?kgicon@20?>: RSW Multi-Lock Attack

Use Repair Kits to repair your AC and recover AP (Armor Points).
Repair Kits can be used up to 3 times per mission, but cannot be used in rapid succession.
<?kgicon@23?>: Use Repair Kit

Use Assault Boost to move rapidly in the direction that the camera is facing, or to rapidly approach targets.
<?kgicon@9?>: Assault Boost <?kgicon@3?> during boost: Cancel Assault Boost
<?kgicon@9?>: Assault Boost <?kgicon@3?> during boost: Cancel Assault Boost
<?kgicon@90?> + <?kgicon@7?>: Quick Boost <?kgicon@17?>: Use Left Hand Weapon
<?kgicon@9?>: Assault Boost <?kgicon@18?>: Use Right Hand Weapon <?kgicon@17?>: Use Left Hand Weapon
<?kgicon@20?>: Use Right Shoulder Weapon Hold <?kgicon@20?>: RSW Multi-Lock Attack

While standing on a vertical catapult, perform a jump to quickly reach high-up places.
<?kgicon@8?> while on catapult: Vertical Launch

You will use an old-gen AC instead of your usual craft on this mission.
This AC is made from junk parts, and its performance leaves much to be desired.
Hold <?kgicon@18?>: Rapid-Fire Right Hand Machine Gun <?kgicon@19?>: Fire Left Shoulder Scatter Bazooka
Hold <?kgicon@18?>: Rapid-Fire Right Hand Machine Gun <?kgicon@19?>: Fire Left Shoulder Scatter Bazooka

Jamming rounds rupture on impact, creating an area effect that disrupts enemy lock-on.
This AC is equipped with a jamming round launcher as its left hand weapon.
<?kgicon@17?>: Fire Left Hand Jamming Round Launcher
Hold <?kgicon@18?>: Rapid-Fire Right Hand Machine Gun <?kgicon@19?>: Fire Left Shoulder Scatter Bazooka <?kgicon@17?>: Fire Left Hand Jamming Round Launcher

To land shots on moving enemies, you must pull the trigger while they are within lock-on range, where target tracking is active.
<?kgicon@18?>: Rapid-Fire Right Hand Weapon
To land shots on moving enemies, you must pull the trigger while they are within lock-on range, where target tracking is active.

Weapons with magazines will automatically reload when the magazine's ammunition is depleted.
Manually reload before engaging the enemy to minimize the risk that your attacks will be interrupted by a reload.
<?kgicon@22?> + <?kgicon@18?>: Manual Reload (Right Hand Weapon)

Weapons with magazines will automatically reload when the magazine's ammunition is depleted.
Manually reload before engaging the enemy to minimize the risk that your attacks will be interrupted by a reload.
<?kgicon@22?> + weapon input: Manual Reload

To use missiles and other homing rounds, keep the enemy on-screen until lock-on completes, then fire.
Some missile weapons are capable of multi-lock, which allows you to attack multiple enemies simultaneously by holding the input for the weapon.
<?kgicon@20?>: Use Right Shoulder Weapon Hold <?kgicon@20?>: Right Shoulder Weapon Multi-Lock Attack <?kgicon@22?> during multi-lock: Cancel Multi-Lock
<?kgicon@20?>: Use Right Shoulder Weapon Hold <?kgicon@20?>: RSW Multi-Lock Attack <?kgicon@22?> during multi-lock: Cancel Multi-Lock

To use missiles and other homing rounds, keep the enemy on-screen until lock-on completes, then fire.
Some missile weapons are capable of multi-lock, which allows you to attack multiple enemies simultaneously by holding the input for the weapon.

Melee weapons, equipped to the left hand, require a risky close-range approach but have high attack power/impact and are useful for destroying shields.
<?kgicon@17?>: Use Left Hand Weapon <?kgicon@17?> <?kgicon@17?>: Left Hand Weapon Chain Attack Hold <?kgicon@17?>: Left Hand Weapon Charge Attack
<?kgicon@17?>: Use Left Hand Weapon <?kgicon@17?> <?kgicon@17?>: LHW Chain Attack Hold <?kgicon@17?>: LHW Charge Attack
Melee weapons, equipped to the left hand, require a risky close-range approach but have high attack power/impact and are useful for destroying shields.

You can detect nearby enemies or containers that hold AC parts by scanning.
Any objects that were detected by the scan will be temporarily highlighted. If an enemy is detected, you will be able to achieve lock on even through walls or other cover.
<?kgicon@25?>: Scan

Some weapons are capable of charge attacks, which exhibit different properties and behavior compared to regular attacks.
<?kgicon@18?>: Use Right Hand Weapon Hold <?kgicon@18?>: Right Hand Weapon Charge Attack <?kgicon@22?> during charge: Cancel Charge
<?kgicon@18?>: Use Right Hand Weapon Hold <?kgicon@18?>: RHW Charge Attack <?kgicon@22?> during charge: Cancel Charge
Some weapons are capable of charge attacks, which exhibit different properties and behavior compared to regular attacks.

The ACS (Attitude Control System) of a craft can be compromised by accumulated strain from the impact of repeated attacks.
ACS overload results in a vulnerable state called "stagger," during which time the afflicted craft will be immobilized and susceptible to critical damage.
Hold <?kgicon@18?>: Right Hand Weapon Charge Attack <?kgicon@17?>: Use Left Hand Weapon
Hold <?kgicon@18?>: RHW Charge Attack <?kgicon@17?>: Use Left Hand Weapon

The ACS (Attitude Control System) of a craft can be compromised by accumulated strain from the impact of repeated attacks.
ACS overload results in a vulnerable state called "stagger," during which time the afflicted craft will be immobilized and susceptible to critical damage.

During stagger, all incoming attacks are treated as "direct hits" and deal much more damage.
<?kgicon@18?>: Use Right Hand Weapon <?kgicon@17?>: Use Left Hand Weapon <?kgicon@20?>: Use Right Shoulder Weapon
<?kgicon@18?>: Use Right Hand Weapon <?kgicon@17?>: Use Left Hand Weapon <?kgicon@20?>: Use Right Shoulder Weapon
During stagger, all incoming attacks are treated as "direct hits" and deal much more damage.

ACS strain inflicted on enemies resets after a brief interval, but a portion of that strain will remain.
Weapons vary in the amount of accumulative strain they inflict, with explosive impact generally leaving the most ACS strain.
<?kgicon@20?>: Use Right Shoulder Weapon

ACS strain inflicted on enemies resets after a brief interval, but a portion of that strain will remain.
Weapons vary in the amount of accumulative strain they inflict, with explosive impact generally leaving the most ACS strain.

Shields, equipped to the left shoulder, can be deployed to reduce incoming damage and ACS strain.
Hold <?kgicon@19?>: Use Left Shoulder Weapon
Shields, equipped to the left shoulder, can be deployed to reduce incoming damage and ACS strain.

Shield output is maximized for 1 to 2 seconds after deployment.
Blocking during this "Initial Guard" window can help to minimize incoming damage and ACS strain.
Hold <?kgicon@19?> in response to warning: Initial Guard
Hold <?kgicon@19?> in response to warning: Initial Guard

Shield output is maximized for 1 to 2 seconds after deployment.
Blocking during this "Initial Guard" window can help to minimize incoming damage and ACS strain.

During Assault Boost rush attacks, small arms that can be used during movement will inflict greater impact, and impact you receive will be reduced.
<?kgicon@9?>: Assault Boost <?kgicon@18?>: Use Right Hand Weapon <?kgicon@17?>: Use Left Hand Weapon
<?kgicon@9?>: Assault Boost <?kgicon@18?>: Use Right Hand Weapon <?kgicon@17?>: Use Left Hand Weapon

During Assault Boost rush attacks, small arms that can be used during movement will inflict greater impact, and impact you receive will be reduced.
<?kgicon@9?>: Assault Boost

Attacks on enemies that are unaware of your presence will inflict greater ACS strain than usual.
<?kgicon@18?>: Use Right Hand Weapon Hold <?kgicon@18?>: Right Hand Weapon Charge Attack <?kgicon@20?>: Use Right Shoulder Weapon Hold <?kgicon@20?>: Right Shoulder Weapon Multi-Lock Attack
<?kgicon@18?>: Use Right Hand Weapon Hold <?kgicon@18?>: RHW Charge Attack <?kgicon@20?>: Use Right Shoulder Weapon Hold <?kgicon@20?>: RSW Multi-Lock Attack
Attacks on enemies that are unaware of your presence will inflict greater ACS strain than usual.

One way to assemble an AC is to install ranged weapons to both hands. This is known as the "Double Trigger" style among veteran pilots.
Double Trigger assemblies using machine guns or similar weapons can destroy enemies at a reliable pace, and are suited for taking on multiple enemies at once.
Hold <?kgicon@18?> & <?kgicon@17?>: Rapid-Fire Both Hand Weapons

One way to assemble an AC is to install ranged weapons to both hands. This is known as the "Double Trigger" style among veteran pilots.
Double Trigger assemblies using machine guns or similar weapons can destroy enemies at a reliable pace, and are suited for taking on multiple enemies at once.
<?kgicon@22?> + <?kgicon@18?>: Reload Right Hand Weapon <?kgicon@22?> + <?kgicon@17?>: Reload Left Hand Weapon

The mobility of an AC is greatly influenced by its overall weight and the type of boosters installed.
This AC is fitted with boosters that have a short QB Reload Time spec, which allows it outpace enemies with consecutive Quick Boost usage.
<?kgicon@90?> + <?kgicon@7?>: Quick Boost

The mobility of an AC is greatly influenced by its overall weight and the type of boosters installed.
• Thrust focus: Prioritizes faster movement • EN-efficiency focus: Reduced risk of EN shortages • QB/AB focus: Improved evasion and rushdown potential

The generator installed to your AC greatly influences the rest of the assembly, from the selection of usable parts to the basic performance of the AC.
This AC is equipped with a generator that prioritizes EN capacity, in order to allow extensive use of aerial maneuvers and Quick Boosts.
Hold <?kgicon@8?>: Ascend <?kgicon@90?> + <?kgicon@7?>: Quick Boost

The generator installed to your AC greatly influences the rest of the assembly, from the selection of usable parts to the basic performance of the AC.
• Output focus: Allows more parts with high EN burden • Capacity focus: For heavy use of EN-consuming actions • Supply focus: Faster recovery after EN use/depletion

The FCS (Fire Control System) installed to the AC affects target tracking at close/medium/long range and missile lock-on/multi-lock time.
This AC is equipped with an FCS that is specialized for close-range combat, allowing it to reliably land attacks with its high-firepower weapons.
<?kgicon@19?>: Use Left Shoulder Weapon

The FCS (Fire Control System) installed to the AC affects target tracking at close/medium/long range and missile lock-on/multi-lock time.
• Close-range focus: Best performance within 130 m • Medium-range focus: Best performance within 130–260 m • Long-range focus: Best performance beyond 260 m
• Missile focus: Shorter time to achieve homing lock

The weapons and selection of parts used to assemble an AC determine its ideal combat range and style.
This AC is equipped with four ranged weapons to specialize in concentrated fire at medium range.
Hold <?kgicon@18?> & <?kgicon@17?>: Rapid-Fire Both Hand Weapons <?kgicon@20?>: Use Right Shoulder Weapon <?kgicon@19?>: Use Left Shoulder Weapon <?kgicon@9?>: Assault Boost
Hold <?kgicon@18?> & <?kgicon@17?>: Rapid-Fire Both Hand Weapons <?kgicon@20?>: Use Right Shoulder Weapon <?kgicon@19?>: Use Left Shoulder Weapon <?kgicon@9?>: Assault Boost

The weapons and selection of parts used to assemble an AC determine its ideal combat range and style.
When assembling an AC, start by choosing weapons and "frame" parts, then look into which "inner" parts are suited to the style of combat you wish to achieve.

Reverse-joint leg units excel at jumping and can also leverage their leg strength to improve Quick Boosts.
These leg units are also capable of high jumps that do not consume EN, making it easier to achieve aerial retreats and shift to aerial combat.
<?kgicon@8?>: Jump <?kgicon@90?> + <?kgicon@7?>: Quick Boost

Reverse-joint leg units excel at jumping and can also leverage their leg strength to improve Quick Boosts.
These leg units are also capable of high jumps that do not consume EN, making it easier to achieve aerial retreats and shift to aerial combat.

The left shoulder grenade cannon on this AC fires explosive rounds that cause area damage upon impact.
When using weapons of this nature, you can exploit area damage to great effect by firing at the ground from an aerial position.
<?kgicon@8?>: Jump <?kgicon@19?>: Use Left Shoulder Weapon

Grenades and plasma launchers fire explosive rounds that cause area damage upon impact.
When using weapons like these, you can exploit area damage to great effect by firing at the ground from an aerial position.

Weapons fall into one of three categories depending on the type of damage they inflict: • Kinetic • Explosive • Energy
The defensive performance of ACs and other craft varies for each of these damage types, determining their susceptibility or resistance.
<?kgicon@18?>: Use Right Hand Weapon <?kgicon@17?>: Use Left Hand Weapon
<?kgicon@18?>: Use Right Hand Weapon <?kgicon@17?>: Use Left Hand Weapon

Weapons fall into one of three categories depending on the type of damage they inflict: • Kinetic • Explosive • Energy
The defensive performance of ACs and other craft varies for each of these damage types, determining their susceptibility or resistance.

Energy weapons produce heat when fired, and this can ultimately result in overheating.
When overheated, the weapon will be temporarily disabled, but functionality will be regained once the weapon has been allowed to cool. Avoid overheating by monitoring your rate of fire.
<?kgicon@18?>: Use Right Hand Weapon Hold <?kgicon@18?>: Right Hand Weapon Charge Attack
<?kgicon@18?>: Use Right Hand Weapon Hold <?kgicon@18?>: RHW Charge Attack

Energy weapons produce heat when fired, and this can ultimately result in overheating.
When overheated, the weapon will be temporarily disabled, but functionality will be regained once the weapon has been allowed to cool. Avoid overheating by monitoring your rate of fire.

Each weapon type behaves differently concerning impact: • Kinetic: Good balance of impact and attack power • Explosive: High impact and high accumulative strain • Energy: Low impact but high attack power
<?kgicon@18?>: Use Right Hand Weapon <?kgicon@17?>: Use Left Hand Weapon <?kgicon@20?>: Use Right Shoulder Weapon <?kgicon@19?>: Use Left Shoulder Weapon
<?kgicon@18?>: Use Right Hand Weapon <?kgicon@17?>: Use Left Hand Weapon <?kgicon@20?>: Use Right Shoulder Weapon <?kgicon@19?>: Use Left Shoulder Weapon

Each weapon type behaves differently concerning impact: • Kinetic: Good balance of impact and attack power • Explosive: High impact and high accumulative strain • Energy: Low impact but high attack power

Ricocheting will occur when enemies have high defense, significantly reducing the damage they take.
To counteract this, try attacking at a closer range, or switch to explosive weapons.

Tetrapod leg units have high loading capacity, and enable AC builds equipped with multiple heavy weapons.
Tetrapod ACs can switch to Hover Mode after ascending off from the ground, allowing them to remain suspended in the air for some time.
<?kgicon@8?> in air: Hover Mode ON/OFF <?kgicon@90?> + <?kgicon@7?>: Quick Boost <?kgicon@18?>: Use Right Hand Weapon <?kgicon@20?>: Use Right Shoulder Weapon
<?kgicon@8?> in air: Hover Mode ON/OFF <?kgicon@90?> + <?kgicon@7?>: Quick Boost <?kgicon@18?>: Use Right Hand Weapon <?kgicon@20?>: Use Right Shoulder Weapon

Tetrapod leg units have high loading capacity, and enable AC builds equipped with multiple heavy weapons.
Tetrapod ACs can switch to Hover Mode after ascending off from the ground, allowing them to remain suspended in the air for some time.
<?kgicon@8?> in air: Hover Mode ON/OFF
<?kgicon@8?> in air: Hover Mode ON/OFF <?kgicon@2?> + <?kgicon@7?>: Quick Boost <?kgicon@18?>: Use Right Hand Weapon <?kgicon@20?>: Use Right Shoulder Weapon

Charge attacks and fire from heavy weapons such as grenade launchers cause more recoil than other attacks, forcing the AC to assume a firing stance.
Tetrapods are capable of absorbing this kind of recoil, allowing these attacks to be executed during movement.
<?kgicon@8?> in air: Hover Mode ON/OFF Hold <?kgicon@18?>: Right Hand Weapon Charge Attack <?kgicon@17?>: Use Left Hand Weapon
<?kgicon@8?> in air: Hover Mode ON/OFF Hold <?kgicon@18?>: RHW Charge Attack <?kgicon@17?>: Use Left Hand Weapon

Charge attacks and fire from heavy weapons such as grenade launchers cause more recoil than other attacks, forcing the AC to assume a firing stance.
Tetrapods are capable of absorbing this kind of recoil, allowing these attacks to be executed during movement.
<?kgicon@8?> in air: Hover Mode ON/OFF <?kgicon@20?>: Use Right Shoulder Weapon <?kgicon@19?>: Use Left Shoulder Weapon

Hover Mode allows you to maintain a high altitude, in turn making it easier to establish a line of fire and lock on without geographical obstruction.
<?kgicon@8?> in air: Hover Mode ON/OFF <?kgicon@17?>: Use Left Hand Weapon Hold <?kgicon@20?>: Right Shoulder Weapon Multi-Lock Attack Hold <?kgicon@19?>: Left Shoulder Weapon Multi-Lock Attack
<?kgicon@8?> in air: Hover Mode ON/OFF <?kgicon@17?>: Use Left Hand Weapon Hold <?kgicon@20?>: RSW Multi-Lock Attack Hold <?kgicon@19?>: LSW Multi-Lock Attack
Hover Mode allows you to maintain a high altitude, in turn making it easier to establish a line of fire and lock on without geographical obstruction.

Tank leg units are heavily armored and boast excellent loading capacity.
In addition to lending themselves to highly durable builds, they are also good candidates for high firepower assemblies. Tank-type ACs are capable of absorbing recoil, which allows them to fire heavy weapons without entering a firing stance.
Hold <?kgicon@18?> & <?kgicon@17?>: Rapid-Fire Both Hand Weapons <?kgicon@20?>: Use Right Shoulder Weapon <?kgicon@19?>: Use Left Shoulder Weapon
<?kgicon@90?> + <?kgicon@6?>: Boost Movement ON <?kgicon@90?> + <?kgicon@7?>: Quick Boost <?kgicon@90?> immediately after QB: Drift

Tank-type ACs can drift to quickly change the direction they are facing.
To execute a drift, move <?kgicon@90?> in the direction you want to face immediately after a Quick Boost.
<?kgicon@90?> + <?kgicon@6?>: Boost Movement ON <?kgicon@90?> + <?kgicon@7?>: Quick Boost <?kgicon@90?> immediately after QB: Drift

Tank leg units are heavily armored and boast excellent loading capacity.
In addition to lending themselves to highly durable builds, they are also good candidates for high firepower assemblies. Tank-type ACs are capable of absorbing recoil, which allows them to fire heavy weapons without entering a firing stance.

Tank-type ACs can drift to quickly change the direction they are facing.
To execute a drift, move <?kgicon@90?> in the direction you want to face immediately after a Quick Boost.
<?kgicon@90?> immediately after QB: Drift
Hold <?kgicon@18?> & <?kgicon@17?>: Rapid-Fire Both Hand Weapons <?kgicon@20?>: Use Right Shoulder Weapon <?kgicon@19?>: Use Left Shoulder Weapon

During real missions, you can expect enemy reinforcements and other changes to the situation.
The test of an advanced mercenary is in their ability to adjust to a wide range of combat scenarios and adapt their AC assembly to meet the needs of the mission.

When Target Assist is disabled, target tracking will benefit from improved performance, and you will have full control over which direction your AC moves in.
Consider situational use of Target Assist and look for opportunities to take full control of your targeting within your level of proficiency as a mercenary.

Explosive attacks have a blast radius, and even if you dodge the initial hit, it's easy to get caught by the blast if you remain on the ground.
Evasive aerial maneuvers are a good way to handle attacks that are difficult to dodge by merely Quick Boosting.
Hold <?kgicon@8?>: Ascend

When a strong enemy seems like an impossible challenge, it's more likely that the assembly of your AC is working against you.
Check out the mercenary support simulators to see how your AC assembly changes your options.

When an enemy is close to being staggered, make sure your weapons aren't about to reload or overheat. You need to be ready to exercise maximum firepower against the target while it's vulnerable.
<?kgicon@22?> + weapon input: Manual Reload

Customize AC assemblies using the parts you have available at the ASSEMBLY menu.
When assembling an AC, ensure that your build keeps within the maximum weight and EN load parameters.
<?kgicon@1014?>: Open Help Menu

Check incoming jobs and sortie on missions from the MISSIONS menu.
Complete missions to progress the story.

Replay missions you have previously completed from the REPLAY MISSION menu. You can also review your rank for each mission from this menu.
• To achieve an S-Rank rating, you must complete the mission without retrying from a checkpoint, while also minimizing incoming damage, time taken, and ammunition consumed.

Purchase AC parts sold by the various corporations and factions from the BUY menu.
• More parts will be available for purchase as you progress through the story or meet certain conditions.

Sell AC parts in your possession from the SELL menu.
• Parts are sold at purchase price and can be repurchased from the BUY menu once sold.
Make AC cosmetic adjustments from the PAINT menu. This includes coloring and texture settings.
Apply emblems in your possession and user-created images to your AC from the DECALS menu.

Combine preset pieces to create original images from the IMAGE EDITOR menu.
• Created images can be applied to ACs as decals or used as emblems.
• If online, you can upload images you have created to receive a Share ID that can be shared with other players, or download other players' shared images.

Fight virtual battles against copies of ACs created using ALLMIND's mercenary/craft data from the ARENA menu.
• Win Arena battles to obtain OST Chips, opponent AC data, and opponent emblems. You can use OST Chips to perform OS upgrades.

Battle against other players in 1-vs-1 or 3-vs-3 online matches from the NEST menu.
• Custom Match The host player creates a Versus Room and guest players join the room to compete or spectate.
• Match History View your win/loss record against recent opponents.

Versus Room matches will begin once sortie members assigned ALPHA/BETA designations have confirmed that they are ready.
If there are not enough sortie members, reserve members who have confirmed that they are ready will be chosen.

Save and load AC assemblies and cosmetic settings from the AC DATA menu.
• In order to load AC data, you must currently own all parts and other elements included in the assembly.
• If online, you can upload AC assemblies you have created to receive a Share ID that can be shared with other players, or download other players' shared assemblies.

Use AC TEST to test the functionality and behavior of your AC.
• During the test run, open the <?kgicon@29?>PAUSE Menu to alter AC assembly, create enemies, and so on.

Learn to pilot an AC and master fundamental battle techniques from the TRAINING menu.
• Complete the exercises using the training AC to earn standardized training parts used for instruction.
Review data logs acquired on missions from the ARCHIVES menu.
From the TIPS menu, review the tutorials seen in training and check basic gameplay information.

Expend OST Chips in your possession to upgrade your AC's OS from the OS TUNING menu.
Upgrading the OS unlocks features and improves functionality.
• OST Chips can be obtained in the Arena.

The following feature is now available:
• PARTS SHOP
New parts are now available for purchase.

The following features are now available:
• OS TUNING • ARENA
New mercenary data added to the Arena.

The following feature is now available:
• NEST

The ANALYSIS category has been added to the Arena.
• Change <?kgicon@1009?> tabs in the ARENA menu to access ANALYSIS.
New craft data has been added to ANALYSIS in the Arena.

The following feature is now available:
• SORTIE

The following feature is now available:
• SORTIE > TRAINING
• Learn the fundamentals of piloting an AC. Complete the exercises to earn standardized training parts used for instruction.
New exercise data added to TRAINING.

You have been invited to join LOGHUNT, one of ALLMIND's mercenary support programs.
• Discover and destroy targets marked with the LOGHUNT target icon to obtain combat logs for submission.
• Collect combat logs and improve your Hunter Class to receive reward parts from ALLMIND.

The following feature is now available:
• AC DESIGN

The Arquebus Corporation has issued you with the following prototype part.
• Shoulder weapon: VE-60SNA ("Stun Needle Launcher")
You have completed the entire training program.
You have collected every combat log.
You have completed all combat aptitude evaluation programs.
You have completed all integration programs.
You have completed every mission with an S-Rank rating.
You have obtained every archive entry.

Hand weapons can be installed to the left and right arm units of an AC.
These weapons range from machine guns and other small arms to heavier weapons, such as a bazookas, that offer high firepower at the cost of forcing the AC to assume a firing stance.
Melee weapons can only be installed to the left hand. However, they all feature excellent attack power and impact potency.

Shoulder weapons can be installed to the left and right back units of an AC.
These weapons include missile launchers, which can be used during movement, as well as heavy weapons like cannons that are too large to be held in the hand.
Shields can only be installed to the left shoulder and offer varying defensive performances and properties.

One of the components that constitute an AC frame.
Heads influence system abnormality resistance and scan performance.
They also affect AP and defensive performance.

One of the components that constitute an AC frame.
Cores apply adjustments to the performance of "inner" parts, namely the boosters and generator.
They also affect AP and defensive performance.

One of the components that constitute an AC frame.
Arms influence the AC's hand weapon carrying capacity, the precision of predictive fire for ranged weapons, the attack power of melee weapons, and so on.
They also affect AP and defensive performance.

One of the components that constitute an AC frame.
Legs influence overall loading capacity for the AC and mobility of on-the-ground movement. They also affect AP and defensive performance.
There are multiple types of leg units with different behavior for jumps, Quick Boosts, and so on.

Boosters greatly influence AC mobility.
Your choice of booster determines the speed of the AC's movements, its speed when ascending, and the thrust of Quick Boosts or Assault Boosts.
However, be aware that higher-performing boosters tend to consume greater and greater amounts of EN (energy).

The FCS (Fire Control System) greatly influences an AC's offensive performance.
Your choice of FCS determines target tracking at close, medium, or long range, and also affects the time it takes to achieve missile lock-on or multi-lock.
Make sure you choose an FCS that is appropriate for the weapons you have chosen.

Generators greatly influence basic AC performance.
Your choice of generator influences the range of parts you can install to your AC and determines EN capacity and recovery speed. When selecting parts, make sure that you choose those that are most compatible with your AC assembly.

Core Expansion: Assault Armor. Creates a pulse explosion centered on the AC, canceling out incoming enemy fire and creating a damaging area-of-effect shockwave.
With Assault Armor equipped, <?kgicon@22?> + <?kgicon@15?>: Activate Assault Armor

Core Expansion: Pulse Armor. Creates a pulse barrier that trails the AC, dramatically increasing defensive performance until it exceeds its durability or time limit.
With Pulse Armor equipped, <?kgicon@22?> + <?kgicon@15?>: Activate Pulse Armor

Core Expansion: Pulse Protection. Creates a pulse barrier in a fixed position, providing cover from enemy fire until the barrier reaches its durability limit. The barrier is not permanent and will disappear after time has passed.
With Pulse Protection equipped, <?kgicon@22?> + <?kgicon@15?>: Activate Pulse Protection

Core Expansion: Terminal Armor. An emergency variant of Pulse Armor that trails the AC, activating when the AC has reached critical AP damage.
When equipped, Terminal Armor activates automatically when your AC is about to be destroyed.

System unlock: Weight Control.
Enables you to sortie using an AC that is over the weight limit, which is normally prohibited. Furthermore, this feature also allows you to manually purge (discard) weapons.
Purging weapons reduces the weight of your AC, allowing you to tactically switch your craft from an overweight state to normal mobility.
<?kgicon@26?> + weapon input: Manually Purge Weapon

System unlock: Boost Kick.
Allows you to kick using the AC's legs as a follow-up action after performing an Assault Boost.
This attack is influenced by the speed and weight of the AC, making it a viable option for overloading an enemy's ACS.
<?kgicon@9?> during Assault Boost: Boost Kick

System unlock: Weapon Bay.
Enables you to equip the left and right shoulders of your AC with two additional hand weapons.
With hand weapons equipped to shoulder units: <?kgicon@20?>: Switch Right Hand Weapon <?kgicon@19?>: Switch Left Hand Weapon

System unlock: Manual Aiming.
Enables manual aiming mode. Generally, it is unrealistic to expect to land attacks in this mode, but it does enable you to "lead" your shots if you can correctly predict enemy movements; that is to say, to shoot where you expect the enemy to be, not where the enemy is.
Hold <?kgicon@15?>: Enable Manual Aiming <?kgicon@15?> with Manual Aiming ON: Disable Manual Aiming

System unlock: Quick Turn.
Enables the ability to perform snap turns to side or rear directions.
<?kgicon@6?> + <?kgicon@2?>: Quick Turn in input direction

AC system abnormality: ACS Failure
Excessively high temperatures cause ACS errors, with the result that incoming impact damage is increased. This in turn makes the AC more vulnerable to stagger.
AC systems will recover a short time after the effect has been triggered.

AC system abnormality: Shock
A sudden overload forces a discharge of the AC's electrical systems, resulting in unavoidable damage.

Basic AC controls are as follows. <?kgicon@91?>: Camera <?kgicon@90?>: Movement <?kgicon@90?> + <?kgicon@6?>: Boost Movement ON <?kgicon@8?>: Jump (Hold: Ascend) <?kgicon@18?>: Use Right Hand Weapon <?kgicon@17?>: Use Left Hand Weapon <?kgicon@20?>: Use Right Shoulder Weapon <?kgicon@19?>: Use Left Shoulder Weapon

While charging a ranged weapon, <?kgicon@22?>: Cancel Charge
During multi-lock, <?kgicon@22?>: Cancel Multi-Lock
During Assault Boost, <?kgicon@3?>: Cancel Assault Boost

AC system abnormality: Camera Disruption
Cameras are impeded by a jamming effect, reducing lock-on range.
System functionality can be restored by escaping the area of effect.
